chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Operate w/out Valid License - Cause Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant George M. Bojszuk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. George M. Bojszuk is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • George M. Bojszuk was found guilty of 2nd Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: To be determined by DOC w/n 30 days.

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*    Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100  ea applicable count).
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $  TBD   plus surcharges.  State shall have 30 days to determine restitution.
May not have contact with Dawn or America M or their residneces, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Extended Supervision Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with stand by counsel Douglas Henderson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 2 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 1 - Plea of no contest; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation waived by parties.  Statement read by victim.  Sentencing arguments made by counsel.
Total length of sentence: 10 years.  
Initial term of confinement: 678 days in WSP, credit for 678 days served.   
Length of extended supervision: 2,972 days w/conditions.  Conditions include no contact with Dawn M. or America M. and payment of restitution, amount to be determined by DOC within 30 days.  Court does not order repayment of Atty Henderson's attorney fees.
signed by KSD officer in court.

Amended bond form signed by DE.  No monetary bond amount set; DE has been released from monetary condition of bond.  Non-monetary conditions are:  Not to possess or consume alcohol; not to possess or consume controlled substances w/o prescription; no contact with Dawn M., Kathy B., Ginalisa H., or America M. or their residences.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  DE appeared (in custody) with stand-by counsel Douglas Henderson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case is close to being resolved.  Court trial on 8/21/17 is removed from the calendar.  Plea and sentencing 10/5/17 at 1:30 in Room 317.  Parties agree to waive a PSI.  The Court finds the violation of the speedy trial demand is statutory and not a constitutional violation.  The Court orders that the appropriate remedy is to release the DE from the monetary conditons of bond.  All non-monetary conditions of bond are still in effect, with the added condition of no contact with America M.  DE verified on the record the address where he will be residing in Antioch, IL.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with stand by counsel Douglas Henderson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Victim-witness notification has not been complied with by the State.  State's witness is unavailable for court trial on 8/21/17.  Speedy trial was demanded by defendant on 6/2/17.  Parties are to meet on 8/16/17 to discuss possible resolution.  The Court takes no action as to adjournment of the 8/21/17 court trial at this time.  Status conf. 8/17/17 at 2:30.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) without counsel.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Douglas Henderson, defendant's stand-by counsel, is unable to attend due to medical issues.  Def.'s motion for sequestration of witnesses is granted by the Court.  Def. waives his right to confer with Atty Henderson or another attorney re waiving his right to a jury trial.  State does not object to waiver of jury trial.  Def.'s motion to waive his right to a jury trial is granted by the Court.  Jury trial set for 8/7/17 is removed from the calendar.  Speedy trial was demanded on 6/2/17.  Court trial set for 8/21/17 at 8:30 (2 days).  Discovery issues addressed.  Atty Krejcarek gives def. copies of the supplementary follow up report frrom Det. Martin with attachments and also Aurora medical records.  Atty Krejcarek will check on the 911 logs to see if there is any additional information there.  Witness list to be provided to def. by the State.  Bond continued.

Amendment to Motion to Include Lesser Charges with Jury Instructions

filed by DE pro se
Motion to Include Lesser Charges with Jury Instructions

ADA E. Trigg on behalf of the State.
DE in person, in custody, pro se, with stand-by counsel, Douglas Henderson. Clerk R. Matoska-Mentink.
Previous motions filed and decided will not be addressed further.
As for motions regarding jury instructions, drug testing for witnesses, lesser included charges with jury instructions 947.01 DV, 940.19 and Jury Instructions 805 and 801 DV, are filed prematurely. No action taken. 
MO for pretrial conference with District Attorney. DAPT to be scheduled between ADA and Atty Henderson.
MO for additional discovery. DE has requested a list of all items in discovery. ADA Trigg reports that there is an open file policy. DE can review after court or during DAPT. Specific request for 9-1-1 tape that DA office reports has been erased. Specific request for reports/field notes from victim interview and/or next door neighbor. ADA Trigg reports that calls are only logged for 120 days and that retention expired by the time request made. 
MO to clarify use of stand-by counsel. DE requests Atty Henderson assistance regarding objections and question of witnesses. No argument on motion from ADA Trigg. DE argues and provides case law interpretation of hybrid assistance. Judge order Atty Henderson to remain as stand by counsel for proceudure and rules of law, and Atty Henderson feels comfortable with the role DE would prefer, contingent upon negotiations with DA. Atty Henderson can request the court to modify these provisions.
MO to provide medical treatment under ADA. Sheriff deals with medical needs of inmates and Court will defer. Motion Denied. 
MO for additional assistance re: Lake County phone calls. DE states that the discs received are voluminous, approximately 130 hours. DE unable to complete this task due to limited computer use. Motion denied.
MO for additional judicial pretrial conference. Addressed with the arrangement of DAPT. 
MO to preserve exculpatory evidence. DA office is bound to retain, preserve and provide exculpatory discovery, and has an open file policy. Denied as it is already required by law.
MO for bond modification for humanitarian reasons. Bond previously set at $5000 cash. MO is out of state and not able to travel. MO denied. 
MO to have access to legal materials during course of trial while in custody. DE states no materials are allowed in holding cells. MO granted by allowing at reasonable times prior to commencement of trial and after jury is discharged, that DE have access to courtroom conference room under supervision of sheriff. If represented by counsel, then this will not occur.
MO to return discovery materials. DE had the interview statement from VI with Lake County while incarcerated in Walworth, that can only be picked up by attorney or sheriff. Atty Henderson states that he went there, and they do not have them. KSD has printed materials that are in his property. Granted in limited scope as to Atty Henderson to review property for items appropriate to defense.
Multiple requests for discovery re: victim advocate statements and notes. ADA says no exculpatory statements have been made by the victim, and victim has not recanted. Call #62 to be reviewed by State. MO denied as State represents they do not have anything more than what is included in their own open file policy. 
Court advises DE re: use of stand by and the ease of using appointed counsel to gain access to requested items in motions. 
DE to provide letter to ADA for items requested, phone calls to be reviewed, and items to be addressed at DAPT.
Matter remains calendared for 8/7/17 at 8:30 a.m. for jury selection.
Application and Order for Specific Judicial Assignment (assigning Reserve Judge Stephen A. Simanek).

Motion hearing on July 18, 2017 at 01:15 pm.
Jury selection on August 7, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on August 8, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Status conf. on 7/18/17 at 1:15 and jury selection on 8/7/17 at 8:30 will remain as scheduled.
Reserve Judge Stephen Simanek assigned.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with stand-by counsel Douglas Henderson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def.'s motion re prescriptions is denied.  Def.'s motion to bar phone recordings from the jail is denied.  Def.'s motion for an investigator to interview witnesses is granted; Atty Henderson to make arrangements.  Def.'s motion for expert witness re accident reconstruction is denied.   Def.'s motion to dismiss is denied.  Def.'s motion for a paralegal is denied.  Def.'s motion for supplemental discovery is denied.  Def.'s motion to have a computer available to play tapes during trial is granted.  Def.'s motion to modify bond to be heard on 5/17/17 at 9:15, with any other motions def. may have.  Bond continued.
